content: ye s yo u c a n by cj brady designs yes you can wear a cowl in the summer just be sure to use a nice summer yarn such as one of the beautiful cotton or cotton and linen blend yarns available pair this cowl with a tank top and enjoy wearing a crochet project in the summer i used the beautiful juniper moon farm zooey cotton and linen yarn check out the pretty colors of this yarn you can go neutral or pick one of the bright colors you do not have to make a long starting chain to begin the cowl because the yes you can cowl is crocheted from end to end and finished with an easy quick whip stitch seam the stitch pattern is a 4 row-repeat that is easy to memorize and the picot edging is crocheted as you go so when you finish crocheting you are finished you can also add on more repeats and make an infinity scarf this cowl is very fast to crochet and you can make it in one afternoon two balls of the zooey yarn makes three cowls and this makes it the perfect gifting crochet project getting started yarn about 170 yards of dk weight yarn suggested yarns juniper moon farm zooey cotton/linen 284 yards/skein sugar bush cabot cotton/linen 291 yards/skein or knit picks cotlin dk cotton/linen 123 yards/skein yarn shown is juniper moon farm zooey in color #06 sel gris hook size g 4 0 mm dimensions as written the cowl will measure 15 inches wide and approximately 30 inches around in circumference and 7 inches tall this pattern is easily modified to make an infinity scarf with additional yarn you can add on additional four-row repeats size one size but can be easily modified to make an infinity scarf gauge not critical medium gauge recommended darning needle for sewing in loose ends and for the final whip stitch seam pattern & photos are copyright © cj brady half_double_crochet double_crochet double_crochet slip_stitch slip_stitch height notes  you will start with a foundation single_crochet fsc row followed by one row and then the main stitch pattern which is an easy four-row repeat if you choose instead of a fsc you can substitute a starting chain of 37 and one row of single crochet for 36 stitches  the row are turned at the beginning of the row with a chain 4 and a slip_stitch in the same stitch as the chain 4 to form a picot the top and bottom edges of the cowl will have the picots  the final seam is an easy whip stitch where the final end
